info.title: Socure API Reference
info.description:
*DevHub is Socure confidential and proprietary information, and is only intended for viewing by authorized persons.* # Overview The Socure ID+ identity verification solution is a real-time, predictive analytics platform that provides identity verification and fraud prediction through a single, modular REST API. ## Authentication When you call Socure's APIs, you must authenticate each request with an ID+ key. Socure associates each ID+ key with a Socure account. You can generate and collect your account's ID+ key from the **Developers > ID+ Keys** page in Admin Dashboard. See [ID+ Keys](/docs/admin-dashboard/developers/id-plus-keys) for more information. ``` Authorization: SocureApiKey a1b234cd-5678-9e01-f234-56abcdef6789 Content-Type: application/json ``` The following table details the base URLs for the Production, Certification, and Sandbox environments and their corresponding authorization header: Environment | Base URL | Authorization Header -------------|----------| ----------------- Production | `https://service.socure.com` | SocureApiKey Certification | `https://service.socure.com` | SocureApiKey Sandbox | `https://sandbox.socure.com` | SocureApiKey ## Traffic Segmentation Traffic segmentation, available for customers with specific provisions using the ID+ `/EmailAuthScore` endpoint, can be implemented by adding the following parameters to a request body when calling ID+ modules:
Parameter Type Description
eventType String Required. Supports a pre-defined enumeration of event types that allow for better customization for transaction processing and billing using the following values: payment, fundsMovement, login, accountOpen, accountChange, and other.
eventSubType String A free-form field that allows the user to provide a more descriptive value for the event (≤ 255 characters).
Note: This field is not needed for a vast majority of clients and is optional. Clients should only implement this field if asked to do so by the Account Manager, who will also advise on what value to use.
channel String Required. Supports a pre-defined enumeration of channels, enabling users to specify the mode of interaction on the consumer's end using the following values: web, mobile, pos, and other.
The example below demonstrates how to include the segmentation object in the body of an API call. ``` { "segmentation": { "eventType": "accountOpen", "eventSubType": "...", "channel": "mobile" } } ``` ## Errors HTTP status codes indicate the success or failure of an API request. If a request fails, the API returns a message with information about the error along with the appropriate status code. See [Exception Handling](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/exception-handling) for more information. > Error messages are intended for debug purposes only and should not be exposed to customers. ``` { "status": "Error", "referenceId": "81cf9bf1-b5ab-4271-bf92-8809ee1bf8d6", "data": { "parameters": [ "Missing required parameters for module: FraudScore" ] }, "msg": "Invalid request. Please check for missing required parameters and resubmit the transaction. " } ``` ### Error codes | Code | Reason | | ---------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | 400 - Bad Request | The request wasn't successful, often due to an invalid, missing, or mutually exclusive parameter. | | 401 - Unauthorized | No valid ID+ key, referenceID, or entity ID was provided. | | 403 - Forbidden | The ID+ key isn't provisioned to serve the request. | | 404 - Not Found | The requested resource doesn't exist. | | 429 - Too Many Requests | You've hit a rate limit. Contact Technical Support to see how we can help you scale responsibly. We default all clients to a rate limit of 10 transactions per second per ID+ key. | | 500, 502, 503, 504 - Server Errors | Something went wrong on Socure's end. On these rare occasions, we're probably already on it but reach out to our support group anyway. | ## Rate Limits Socure defaults all clients to a rate limit of 10 transactions per second (TPS) per ID+ key (except the Image Request endpoint, which has a rate limit of 1 TPS). To increase rate limits for your account, contact [Technical Support](/support). ## Requests HTTPS is required for all API calls to Socure endpoints. TLS 1.3 is the default and preferred protocol version for encryption; however, we do allow TLS 1.2 as a minimum version when making ID+ API calls. ### Authorization You must provide an authorization header as described in the [Authentication](/reference#section/Overview/Authentication) section above. ### Content-Type The Content-Type header identifies the media type of the content in the request body. For all requests with a body, the body may be in JSON format, or other formats as specified for the endpoint. ## Responses Calls to the ID+ Platform return HTTP status codes. Some API calls also return a JSON response body that includes information about the resource. See the **Responses** section for each endpoint to learn more. # Postman Collection Socure provides a Postman collection for consumers to make API calls through the Sandbox environment. The collection contains sample use cases with requests to various ID+ modules. For effective testing in Postman, we suggest the following: - Download and import the pre-built environments provided below into Postman. These environments contain examples of consumer Personally Identifiable Information (PII) that you can set before making any call. - To streamline input and avoid repetition, configure the base URLs, authorization, and device session ID as variables. See [Set environment variables](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/environment-variables/) for more information. - For testing the `devicerisk` module in the Sandbox environment, use the test device session IDs provided in the [Device Risk Examples](/docs/advanced-concepts/sandbox-test-scenarios/#device-risk-examples) document. # Backward Compatible Changes Socure considers the following changes to be backward compatible: - Adding new API resources. - Adding new optional request parameters to existing API methods. - Adding new properties to existing API responses. - Changing the order of properties in existing API responses.

tags.name: ID+
tags.description:
ID+ is the primary endpoint of the Socure API. The ``modules`` parameter
in the request body determines which ID+ services are called. See [Products Overview](/docs/id-plus/modules/products-overview) and [ID+ Endpoint](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/idplus-endpoint) for more information.

tags.name: Predictive Document Verification
tags.description:
[Predictive Document Verification](/docs/id-plus/modules/docv/docv-overview) (DocV) confirms the authenticity of a government-issued ID, matches the Personal Identifiable Information (PII) extracted from the ID against the input information, and matches the ID headshot to a consumer-submitted selfie using facial biometric analysis.

The DocV APIs in this section allow you to integrate DocV services into your application.

tags.name: One-Time Passcode Verification
tags.description: The [One-Time Passcode Verification APIs](/docs/id-plus/modules/one-time-passcode-verification) allow you to securely verify user identities.

tags.name: Reason Code
tags.description: [Reason Codes](/docs/advanced-concepts/reason-codes) are a series of alphanumeric codes returned by the ID+ endpoint that help explain what predictors were used to determine a score. See [Reason Codes Endpoint](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/reason-code-endpoint) for more information.

tags.name: Transaction Details
tags.description:
The Transaction Details API allows you to use the reference ID 
of a previous transaction to view response data. See 
[Transaction Details Endpoint](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/transaction-details-endpoint) for more information.

 **Note**: The Transaction Details API is only available in the Certification and Production environments.

tags.name: Feedback
tags.description:
The Feedback API allows you to send labeled transaction data in real-time. This information 
should be sent for all ID+ transactions when the following occurs:

* The moment final application decisions are made.
* The moment account status changes on the Fraud Outcome or Delinquency buckets.

See [Socure Risk Insights Network](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/feedback/feedback-overview) 
for more information.

tags.name: Custom Watchlist
tags.description: The Custom Watchlist API allows you to add, update, or remove records from a custom watchlist. See [How to Use a Custom Watchlist](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/configuration/upload-custom-source-list) for more information.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: The Events API allows you to manage webhook events for Global Watchlist and Predictive DocV transactions.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when an event occurs. Details about the event are sent via 
a HTTP `POST` request to the URL you specify. 

When you receive a new event, you must return a `200` HTTP status code. If you do not send a `200` response, Socure 
will attempt to redeliver the event. After five failed attempts over two days, the event delivery is marked as a 
failure and the webhook is disabled.

 **Note**: For auto-enrolled transactions, we will attempt to redeliver the notification until it is successfully received.

See [Webhooks Overview](/docs/webhooks/overview) for more information.

tags.name: Webhook Secret Key
tags.description: A webhook secret key is a user-defined token that allows you to verify that events sent to your endpoint are legitimate. Secret keys are configured at the account-level and apply to all environments. Only one secret key can be active at a time per subscription type.

get.description: Returns a complete list of reason codes in ID+.
Returns all response data for a completed transaction using the `referenceId` value.

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: The `referenceId` parameter returned in the API response of a completed transaction.

post.description:
Initiates a document request by generating a one-time-use URL that redirects the consumer to the Capture App to complete the document capture and upload process. See [Document Request Endpoint Version 5](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/document-request/overview) for more information.

The URL of the Document Request endpoint for Production, Certification, and Sandbox is `https://service.socure.com/api/5.0/documents/request`. In the request header, include the `Socure_ID+_Key` for the corresponding environment as shown below:
  Environment | Endpoint URL | Authorization Header
  -------------|----------| -----------------
  Production |   `https://service.socure.com/api/5.0/documents/request`    | SocureApiKey <Your_Production_ID+_Key>
  Certification |   `https://service.socure.com/api/5.0/documents/request`    | SocureApiKey <Your_Certification_ID+_Key>
  Sandbox | `https://service.socure.com/api/5.0/documents/request` | SocureApiKey <Your_Sandbox_ID+_Key>

> The **Document Request endpoint (v3)** is planned for deprecation in a future release.
New integrations should use **Document Request endpoint (v5)**.

Initiates a document request by generating a one-time-use URL that redirects the consumer to the Capture App to complete the document capture and upload process. See [Document Request Endpoint Version 3](/legacy-integrations/document-requst-endpoint-v3/overview) for more information.

The URL of the Document Request endpoint for Production, Certification, and Sandbox is `https://service.socure.com/api/3.0/documents/request`. In the request header, include the `Socure_ID+_Key` for the corresponding environment as shown below:
  Environment | Endpoint URL | Authorization Header
  -------------|----------| -----------------
  Production |   `https://service.socure.com/api/3.0/documents/request`    | SocureApiKey <Your_Production_ID+_Key>
  Certification |   `https://service.socure.com/api/3.0/documents/request`   | SocureApiKey <Your_Certification_ID+_Key>
  Sandbox | `https://service.socure.com/api/3.0/documents/request` | SocureApiKey <Your_Sandbox_ID+_Key>

> **Note:** You can use the `verificationLevel` field in this endpoint to have the Capture App call ID+ with the Predictive Document Verification and PhoneRisk Score modules after the document capture and upload process is complete. The ID+ results are then returned as a new event using webhooks.

get.description: Get a ZIP file containing copies of a consumer's uploaded ID and selfie images from Socure's servers. See [Image Request Endpoint Version 5](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/image-request-endpoint) for more information.

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: The unique reference ID for the DocV transaction. Retrieve this value from the ID+ API response after you call the Predictive Document Verification module.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Returns the specified image only. If omitted, the API will return all images.

get.description:
> The **Image Request endpoint (v3)** is planned for deprecation in a future release.
New integrations should use **Image Request endpoint (v5)**.

Get a ZIP file containing copies of a consumer's uploaded ID and selfie images from Socure's servers. See [Image Request Endpoint Version 3](/legacy-integrations/image-request-endpoint-version-3) for more information.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier associated with the uploaded images. The ``uuid`` is returned in the response when you upload an ID using the Document Upload endpoint.

parameters.name: imagequality
parameters.description:
The quality of the retrieved images.

The API returns the original images by default. Specify ``optimized`` to retrieve copies of the images that are compressed to a smaller file size. Only images above 650 DPI are optimized.

> **Note**: We recommend retrieving the original images.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Returns the specified image only. If omitted, the API will return all images.

post.description:
Manually expire a DocV transaction token associated with an existing session. Once expired, users will no longer be able to capture or upload images to the session.

> **Note**: This endpoint is only available for DocV integrations using version 5.0 or later.

docvTransactionToken.description: The transaction token retrieved from the API response of the Document Request endpoint v5.

referenceId.description: A unique reference ID for the transaction.

post.description: Generate a one-time code for a user’s phone number or email address.

destination.description: The user's phone number (E.164 format) or email address where the OTP will be sent. International phone numbers are supported.

channel.description: The delivery method, which can be `sms`, `voice`, or `email`.

post.description: Verify a one-time passcode entered by the user.

verificationId.description: The unique identifier returned from the OTP send request. This connects the verification attempt to the specific OTP that was sent.

otp.description: The 6-digit numerical code entered by the user. This should be the exact code received by the user via SMS, voice, or email.

post.description:
Use this endpoint to add a webhook secret key to your events. 

See [Webhook Best Practices](/docs/webhooks/best-practices) for more information.

Allows you to manage the following Global Watchlist transaction information:

- Enable Global Watchlist monitoring for a transaction.
- Disable Global Watchlist monitoring.
- Suppress an entity match from appearing in future notifications.
- Unsuppress an entity match.

See [Monitor Global Watchlist Transactions](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/monitor-transaction) for more information.

> **Note**: To enable transaction monitoring in the Sandbox environment, scenarios must first be preconfigured by Socure. For more details, contact your Technical Account Manager.

get.description:
Retrieves the following Global Watchlist transaction information:

- The monitoring status of a Global Watchlist transaction.
- A list of actively monitored Global Watchlist transactions.
- Global Watchlist monitoring transaction details.

**Note:** The default timeout is 60 seconds. If the callout is timing out when you are retrieving a list of actively monitored Global Watchlist transactions, try reducing the date range specified in the `dateFrom` and `dateTo` parameters.

Retrieves the details of each event that has occurred during a transaction with the DocV Web SDK or Document Request endpoint.
**Note:** You can retrieve transactions created in the Sandbox environment by using the ID+ key for the Certification environment.

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: The reference ID of the DocV transaction.

parameters.name: snapshot
parameters.description: Indicates whether to return snapshot details for the transaction.

post.description:
A new event is observed for a monitored transaction, such as the addition or removal of a 
person or non-person entity from a sanctions list.

See [Monitor Global Watchlist Transactions](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/monitor-transaction) for more information.

A new transaction is automatically enrolled in Global Watchlist monitoring. 

See [Monitor Global Watchlist Transactions](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/monitor-transaction) for more information.

Receive event notifications as a consumer progresses through each step in the document capture process. 

The webhook events in this section apply to integrations using the **DocV Web SDK** or **Document Request endpoint version 5** (or later). See [Predictive DocV Webhook Events Version 5](/docs/webhooks/docv-events) for more information.

post.summary: Predictive DocV Multiple Document Capture events
post.description:
Receive event notifications in a [Multiple Document Capture flow](/docs/id-plus/endpoints-and-apis/document-request/example-integrations/multiple-document-capture). In this transaction, each requested document within the Capture App flow can trigger the corresponding events.  

 > **Note**: This webhook events in this section are only available for DocV integrations using version 5.0 or later.

SocureApiKey.name: SocureApiKey <INSERT_KEY_HERE>
SocureApiKey.description: Socure provides separate ID+ keys for the Sandbox, Certification, and Production environments. Be sure to use the correct key when making a request.

EIN.description: Employer Identification Number (EIN) value used to identify a business entity. Recommended when `businessName` is present.

AccountNumber.description: The account number for which account validations are being performed.

RoutingNumber.description: The account routing number for which account validations are being performed.

Inquiries.description:
The inquiry type. Below are the possible values. 
- `AVAILABILITY`: Used to confirm a bank account's availability. 
- `OWNERSHIP`: Used to verify a bank account's ownership.

Account.title: Account
Account.description: The bank account information and inquiry types associated with the transaction.

CustomerUserID.description: A client-specified unique identifier for the transaction.

UserID.description: Contains a unique partner or integrator-specified identifier for the end-user. Only partners or integrators should use this field.

Segmentation.description: Supports traffic segmentation and categorization when included in the request.

eventType.description:
Specifies an event type used for this transaction to allow for better customization for transaction processing and billing. Available values include: `payment`, `fundsMovement`, `login`, `accountOpen`, `accountChange`, and `other`.
> **Note**: 
  > - This parameter is required for `segmentation`. 
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

eventSubType.description:
Free-form field that allows for a more descriptive value for the event.
> **Note**: This field is not needed for a vast majority of clients and is optional. Clients should only implement this field if asked to do so by the Account Manager, who will also advise on what value to use.

channel.description:
Specifies the mode of interaction on the consumer's end. Available values include: `web`, `mobile`, `pos`, and `other`. 
> **Note**: 
  > - This parameter is required for `segmentation`. 
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.
> **Note**: You must specify the inquiry request type for Account Intelligence in the `inquiries` parameter. The inquiry type will determine which other parameters are required.

firstName.description:
The consumer’s first name. 
> **Note**: 
> - UTF-8 single byte latin characters are supported.
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - This parameter is required for `OWNERSHIP` inquiries of a consumer account.
> - The field accepts backslashes to prevent HTTP 400 errors; these are removed during preprocessing to guard against injection attacks and ensure consistent data storage, resulting in an HTTP 200 response. If a backslash is the only input, it returns an empty string.

surName.description:
The consumer’s last name.
> **Note**:  
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - This parameter is required for `OWNERSHIP` inquiries of a consumer account.

entityName.description:
The business entity name. 
> **Note**: 
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - This parameter is required for `OWNERSHIP` if `firstName` and `surName` are not provided.

physicalAddress.description: The first line of the consumer or business's address.

physicalAddress2.description: An optional second line for the address.

city.description: The city where the consumer or business resides.

state.description:
The state, province, or region where the consumer or business resides, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.
> **Note**: If the physical address is in a country or state that does not require `state`, do not include this field in the API call.

zip.description:
The consumer or business's five or nine-digit ZIP code in valid postal address format. Hyphens and spaces are optional.
If the physical address is in a country or state that does not require `zip`, do not include this field in the API call. > **Note**: This field accepts a 9-digit zip code, with spaces allowed in place of hyphens (e.g., `94502 1397` instead of `94502-1397`).

country.description:
The country where the consumer or business resides, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.
> **Note**: This field is not case-sensitive.

nationalId.description: The consumer's nine-digit Social Security number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN). The last four digits of the SSN are also accepted. Hyphens and spaces are optional.

mobileNumber.description:
The consumer’s phone number, preferably in E.164 format. Hyphens are optional. A mobile phone number is preferred. Recommended when `firstName` and `surName` are present.
> **Note**: If the country code is missing, the system will default to a North American phone number.

businessPhone.description: The business's phone in E.164 format. Hyphens are optional. Recommended when `entityName` is present.

dob.description: The consumer's date of birth, preferably in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYYMMDD, or YYYY/MM/DD format.

payments.description: The bank account information associated with the transaction.

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.
> **Note**: You must specify the inquiry request type for Account Intelligence in the `inquiries` parameter. The inquiry type will determine which other parameters are required.

The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.

  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

ReturnSignals.description:
When set to `true`, returns Signals in the response alongside standard scores
and reason codes. If omitted or false, Signals are not returned.

FirstName.description:
The consumer’s first name. 
> **Note**: 
> - UTF-8 single byte latin characters are supported.
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - The field accepts backslashes to prevent HTTP 400 errors; these are removed during preprocessing to guard against injection attacks and ensure consistent data storage, resulting in an HTTP 200 response. If a backslash is the only input, it returns an empty string.

Surname.description:
The consumer’s last name. 
> **Note**: 
> - UTF-8 single byte latin characters are supported.
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - The field accepts backslashes to prevent HTTP 400 errors; these are removed during preprocessing to guard against injection attacks and ensure consistent data storage, resulting in an HTTP 200 response. If a backslash is the only input, it returns an empty string.

PhysicalAddress.description: The first line of the consumer's address.

PhysicalAddress2.description: An optional second line for the address.

City.description: The city where the consumer resides.

State.description:
The state, province, or region where the consumer resides, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.
> **Note**: 
> - If the physical address is within a U.S. territory, you can pass the territory name in either the `state` or `country` field.
> - If the physical address is in a country or state that does not require `state`, do not include this field in the API call.

Zip.description:
The consumer's five or nine-digit ZIP code must be in a valid postal address format. Hyphens or spaces are optional.
> **Note**: 
  > - If the physical address is in a country or state that does not require `zip`, do not include this field in the API call.
  > - This field accepts a 9-digit zip code, with spaces allowed in place of hyphens (e.g., `94502 1397` instead of `94502-1397`).

Country.description:
The country where the consumer resides, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.
> **Note**: 
  > - If the physical address is within a U.S. territory, you can pass the territory name in either the `state` or `country` field.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

phone.description:
The shipping recipient's phone number in E.164 format. 
A mobile phone number is preferred.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.
> 1. `city`, `state`
> 2. `zip`

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the `modules` array, you must also include at least 
one of the following parameters in the request.
> 1. `nationalId`
> 2. `email`
> 3. `mobileNumber`

nationalId.description:
The consumer's nine-digit Social Security number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN). 

> **Note**: A match is only returned on full 9-digit numbers with no dashes, dots, or spaces.

email.description:
The consumer's email address.

> **Note**: 
> - Must conform to RFC 5322 format and contain a valid top-level domain.
> - Emails are internally converted to lowercase and special characters are removed where applicable to avoid potential mismatches.

mobileNumber.description:
The consumer’s phone number, preferably in E.164 format. Hyphens are optional. A mobile phone number is preferred.
> **Note**: If the country code is missing, the system will default to a North American phone number.

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

NationalID.description: The national identification number of the consumer. For the US, it's the nine-digit Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN). The last four digits of the SSN are also accepted. Hyphens are optional.

MobileNumber.description:
The consumer’s phone number in E.164 format, which includes the country code (e.g., `+` followed by international dialing code and number).
Hyphens are optional. A mobile phone number is preferred.

Example formats:
- United States: `+13475550100`
- United Kingdom: `+447911123456`
- Brazil: `+5511987654321`
- India: `+919876543210`
- Australia: `+61412345678`

> **Note**: If the country code is omitted, the system will default to a North American number format.

nameDob.description: Overrides the default match criteria settings requiring the consumer's name and date of birth to match.

nameFuzzinessTolerance.description:
Determines the match threshold for the consumer's name. Valid values are any number between 0 and 1 with decimal precision.
Zero (0) is an exact match, while one (1) allows for a broad match.
  > **Note**: If not specified explicitly in the request, the default value for this field will use the value set in the [Global Watchlist Settings](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/configuration/settings/global-watchlist-settings).

when the date of birth is provided at the following match levels: `exact_yyyy_mm_dd`, `one_year_radius_yyyy_mm_dd`, `exact_yyyy`, `one_year_radius_yyyy`.

countries.description: The countries from which to pull PEP and adverse media results. Values should be entered in a two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: The Graph Intelligence module is an add-on module and must be included in the request with one of the following modules:
> - `phonerisk`
> - `emailrisk`
> - `fraud`
> - `synthetic`
> - `firstpartyfraud`
> - `kyc`
> - `kycplus`
>
> Additional minimum required input fields are determined by the included modules.

nationalId.description:
The national identification number of the consumer. For the US, it's the nine-digit Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN).

> **Note**: A full 9-digit `nationalId` is required.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.
> **Note**: In addition to the `modules` array, you must also include at least one of the following parameters in the request.
> - `nationalId`
> - `email`
> - `mobileNumber`
> - `firstName`
> - `surName`
> - `ipAddress`
> - `deviceSessionId`

The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: To receive the phone correlation value in the response, 
include the following parameters in the request.
> - `firstName`
> - `surName`

mnoStatus.description: Specifies whether the Real-Time SIM Swap Verification service should be included in the API call with the Phone Risk module. > **Note**: > - Set this field to `true` to enable the service. > - Otherwise, set to `false` or omit this field to perform only the standard risk validations provided by the Phone Risk service.

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

DocumentUUID.description:
The UUID of the uploaded images. This field is returned by the Capture App after the consumer successfully uploads their ID and selfie images.
> **Note**: This field is required for legacy SDK or API integrations. See [Call the Predictive Document Verification Module with the ID+ API](/docs/id-plus/modules/docv/call-docv-module) for more information.

DriverLicenseState.description: The two letter postal code of the issuing state.

PreviousReferenceID.description: The `referenceId` of a previous ID+ transaction. Allows you to link multiple transactions together. See [Transaction Linkage](docs/id-plus/modules/docv/transaction-linkage) for more information.

modules.description: The name of the ID+ module.

docvTransactionToken.description:
The transaction token retrieved from the API response of the Document Request endpoint v5.
> **Note**: This field only applies to DocV integrations using version 5.0 or later.

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

authorityVerificationConfig.description: Configurations for how and when a [Source of Truth check](/docs/id-plus/modules/docv/source-of-truth-check) is applied to the DocV transaction.

enabled.description: Enables or disables the SoT check service for the transaction.

runOnAcceptDecisionOnly.description: When set to `true`, the SoT check is performed on a DocV transaction with an `accept` decision. By default, this field is set to `false`.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module. 

#### For Standard Prefill, the following PII are required in addition to the `modules` array:
  - `firstName`
  - `surname`
  - One of the following PII:
    - `nationalId` (The last 4 digits of the consumer's SSN/ITIN)
    - `mobileNumber`
    - `email`
    - `physicalAddress` + `zip`
    - `physicalAddress` + `city` + `zip`

#### For Enhanced Prefill (Single PII), **one** of the following PII is required in addition to the `modules` array:
  - `mobileNumber`
  - `email`
  - Address:
    - `physicalAddress` + `zip` **OR** 
    - `physicalAddress` + `city` + `state` + `zip`
  - `nationalId` (The full 9 digits of the consumer's SSN/ITIN)

nationalId.description: The full nine or last four digits of the consumer's SSN or ITIN. The last four digits is recommended. Hyphens are optional.

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

docvTransactionToken.description: The transaction token retrieved from the API response of the Document Request endpoint v5.

> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.
> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least one of the following sets of parameters in the request:
  > 1. `nationalId`
  > 2. `firstName`, `surName`, `dob`, `country`
  > 3. `firstName`, `surName`, `country`, `driverLicense`, `driverLicenseState`
  > 4. `firstName`, `surName`, `physicalAddress`, `zip`, `country`  
  > 5. `firstName`, `surName`, `physicalAddress`, `city`, `state`, `country`  
  > 6. `firstName`, `surName`, `country`, `email`                  
  > 7. `firstName`, `surName`, `country`, `mobileNumber`

disclosurePurpose.description: This field must be set to `GLBA_502(e)` to support acceptable use of the product. Data contributed to Sigma First-Party Fraud is Non-Public Information (NPI) that may only be further disclosed pursuant to the GLBA fraud exception.

driverLicense.description: The driver's license ID number as it appears on the consumer's driver's license card.

driverLicenseState.description: The driver's license state as it appears on the consumer's driver's license card.

useCase.description: The type of transaction (for example, Application, ACH, or Card).

uniqueIdTransaction.description: A customer identified unique transaction key.

initiationDate.description: The date the transaction is initiated.

nationalId.description: The consumer's nine-digit Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number (ITIN). Hyphens and spaces are optional.

firstName.description:
The consumer’s first name. 
> **Note**: 
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - The field accepts backslashes to prevent HTTP 400 errors; these are removed during preprocessing to guard against injection attacks and ensure consistent data storage, resulting in an HTTP 200 response. If a backslash is the only input, it returns an empty string.

surName.description:
The consumer’s last name.
> **Note**: 
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - The field accepts backslashes to prevent HTTP 400 errors; these are removed during preprocessing to guard against injection attacks and ensure consistent data storage, resulting in an HTTP 200 response. If a backslash is the only input, it returns an empty string.

dob.description: The consumer's date of birth, preferably in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYYMMDD, or YYYY/MM/DD format.

mobileNumber.description:
The consumer’s phone number, preferably in E.164 format. Hyphens are optional. A mobile phone number is preferred.
> **Note**: If the country code is missing, the system will default to a North American phone number.

physicalAddress.description: The first line of the consumer's address.

city.description: The city where the consumer resides.

state.description: The state, province, or region where the consumer resides, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.

zip.description:
The consumer's five or nine-digit ZIP code in valid postal address format. Hyphens and spaces are optional.
> **Note**: This field accepts a 9-digit zip code, with spaces allowed in place of hyphens (e.g., `94502 1397` instead of `94502-1397`).

uniqueIdUser.description: Client provided unique User ID. This value may repeat itself across financial institutions by chance.

uniqueIdAccount.description: Client provided unique Account ID. This value may repeat itself across financial institutions by chance.

amount.description: Transaction amount listed in US dollar and cents (negative if it's a debit from the account and positive if it's a credit).

description.description: Description associated with the transaction (for example, transaction details as included on a consumer's statement).

direction.description: The role of the account in the transaction. Possible values are `originator` if originating the transaction request or `receiver` if receiving the transaction request.

counterPartyInstitution.description: The name of the institution with which the transaction is being completed.

counterPartyType.description: The type of account with which the transaction is being completed. Possible values are `consumer` or `business`.

counterPartyRouting.description: The routing number of the external account associated with the transaction (entered as a string).

counterPartyAccount.description: The account number of the external account associated with the transaction (entered as a string).

ipAddress.description: The consumer's IP address in IPv4 decimal or IPv6 hexadecimal format.

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

Address.title: Addresses
Address.description: The addresses associated with a transaction. Each address must be a unique type. Up to three addresses are allowed.

line1.description: The first line of the address.

line2.description: An optional second line for the address.

city.description: The city in which the address is located.

state.description: The state, province, or region in which the address is located, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.

postalCode.description: The five or nine-digit ZIP code in valid postal address format. Hyphens are optional.

country.description: The country in which the address is located, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

CompanyName.description: The name of the consumer's employer.

Payments.title: Payments
Payments.description: Money transfer details for the transaction.

recipientCountry.description: The country where the recipient of the money transfer resides, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

id.description: A unique identifier for the merchant.

category.description: A free-form text field for merchant category information.

OrderChannel.description: The channel through which the order was submitted.

OrderAmount.description: The total amount of the order.

SubmissionDate.description: The date on which the order was submitted.

PrevOrderCount.description: The total number of orders previously submitted by the account.

PrevUnpaidOrderCount.description: The number of orders for which the account still owes money.

LastOrderDate.description:
The date on which the most recent order was submitted.
> **Note:** If there are no previous orders, set the value to `null`.

AccountCreationDate.description: The date on which the account was created.

GeoCode.description: The geolocation where the consumer currently resides, specified in ISO 6709 format.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.
> 1. `email`
> 2. `mobileNumber`
> 3. `physicalAddress`, `zip`
> 4. `physicalAddress`, `city`, `zip`
> 5. `physicalAddress`, `state`, `zip`

countryOfOrigin.description:
The country or jurisdiction from where the transaction originates, specified in ISO-2 country codes format.
> **Note**: 
  > - This field explicitly refers to the originating country for the transaction passed into ID+, and does not bear any relation to the origin of an applicant’s residential history.
  > - This field is not case-sensitive.

modules.description: The name of the ID+ module.

dob.description:
The consumer's date of birth, preferably in `YYYY-MM-DD`, `YYYYMMDD`, or `YYYY/MM/DD` format.

> **Note**:  Although `dob` is listed as required, the API will not return an error if it’s omitted — as long as at least one of the following is present:
> - `email`
> - `mobileNumber`
> - Both `physicalAddress` **and** `zip`

gender.description:

driverLicense.description: The driver's license ID number as it appears on the consumer's driver's license card.

driverLicenseState.description: The driver's license state as it appears on the consumer's driver's license card.

userConsent.description:

AccountIntelligenceResponse.title: Account Intelligence
AccountIntelligenceResponse.description:
Validates a bank account's availability and ownership. Conditional parameters are
physicalAddress, city, state, country, zip, nationalId, ein, mobileNumber, dob.

accountIntelligence.description: Contains the `account` object and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

account.description: Contains the availability and ownership results.

availabilityScore.description: Results of the bank account availability confirmation. A higher score represents a greater likelihood that the account is open (and not in a closed state).

ownershipScore.description: Results of the bank account ownership validation. A higher score indicates a greater corroboration between the provided PII and the known information on the account.

AccountIntelligencePremierResponse.title: Account Intelligence Premier
AccountIntelligencePremierResponse.description:
Validates a bank account's availability and ownership. Conditional parameters are
physicalAddress, city, state, country, zip, nationalId, ein, mobileNumber, dob.

accountIntelligencePremier.description: Contains the `account` object and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

account.description: Contains the availability and ownership results.

availabilityScore.description: Results of the bank account availability confirmation. A higher score represents a greater likelihood that the account is open (and not in a closed state).

ownershipScore.description: Results of the bank account ownership validation. A higher score indicates a greater corroboration between the provided PII and the known information on the account.

AddressRiskResponse.title: Address Risk
AddressRiskResponse.description:
Returns address risk and correlation scores. Conditional parameters are
physicalAddress, city, state, zip.

nameAddressCorrelation.description: Contains the address correlation value and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Indicates the strength of the relationship between the address and the consumer's `firstName` and `surName`.

addressRisk.description: Contains the address risk score and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

scores.description: A list of risk scores for this transaction.

score.description: Represents the level of risk associated with an address. A higher score indicates a greater likelihood of fraud.

signals.description: Signals returned by the Address Risk product.

correctedPostalCode.description: If address standardization resulted in a correction to the input postal code, the corrected value is returned here. Otherwise, this value will be null.

postalExtension.description: Postal code extension. In the US, this is the last 4 digits of a 9-digit ZIP code.

timezone.description: The regional timezone associated with where the address is located. As a regional indicator of the timezone, this value does not change based on Daylight Savings Time.

timezoneOffset.description: The current offset of the address's timezone compared to GMT. Multiples of 100 are hours and the last two digits are minutes (e.g., 530 = +5:30). Changes with DST.

isDST.description: Whether the timezone the address is located in is currently observing Daylight Savings Time (DST).

localHour.description: The current hour of the day at the location of the IP expressed in 24-hour format, ranging from 0 to 23.

buildingType.description: The type of building at this address, specified as "single-unit", "multi-unit", "p.o. box" or "general delivery".

purpose.description: The purpose of this address, including whether the address is commercial, residential, or relates to educational, military, or correctional purposes. Possible values are: "university", "university housing", "military", "correctional", "p.o. box", "commercial", "residential".

isFiller.description: Whether the address matches a list of commonly used filler values.

AlertListResponse.title: Alert List
AlertListResponse.description: Socure maintains an Alert List of known fraudulent users and specific identifying traits, as reported by Socure and its customers. Submitted data is checked against that list according to variable matching logic and processing. Any potential matching fields are then displayed in the JSON response, along with associated reason codes.

alertList.description: Contains applicable reason codes and a `matches` array listing matching elements and related info across all Alert List datasets.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

matches.description: Contains information for each hit on a source list that matches the input entity.

element.description: The submitted data parameter where a match was found.

datasetName.description: The name of the dataset used.

reason.description: The reason for the inclusion on the Alert List.

industryName.description:
The business or industry type that performed the Alert Listing. Below are the possible values. 
- `Aviation`
- `Banking`
- `Credit Bureau`
- `E-Commerce`
- `Information Technology`
- `Insurance`
- `Lending`
- `Marketplace`
- `Payments`

reportedCount.description: The number of times the PII element has been reported or seen as part of a fraudulent transaction.

SigmaDeviceResponse.title: Device Risk
SigmaDeviceResponse.description: Contains reason codes and historical metrics for the device.

deviceRisk.description: Contains Device Risk reason codes and risk score.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.
A list of reason codes for this transaction.

information.description: Information on the device manufacturer, operating system, and browser.

deviceManufacturer.description:
The device manufacturer.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

deviceModelNumber.description:
The device model number.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

operatingSystem.description:
The device operating system.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

operatingSystemVersion.description:
The device operating system version.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

browserType.description:
The device browser.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

browserVersion.description:
The device browser version. 
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

geolocation.description: Information on the device location based on the IP address and GPS data.

ipGeolocation.description: Device location data based on the IP address.

coordinates.description: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the device.

city.description: The city in which the device is located.

state.description: The state in which the device is located.

zip.description: The zip code in which the device is located.

country.description: The country in which the device is located.

gpsGeolocation.description: Device location data based on GPS data.

coordinates.description: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the device.

observations.description: Information on when a device was first seen and last seen by Socure.

firstSeen.description: The date and time when the device was first seen, specified in UTC non-ISO format.

lastSeen.description: The date and time when the device was last seen, specified in UTC non-ISO format.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique first names seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the first name.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique surnames seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the surname.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique emails seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the email.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique mobile numbers seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the mobile number.

statisticalId.description:
Statistical ID used for statistical relinking. 
> **Note**: DO NOT USE as a unique identifier.

isVirtualMachine.description: Set to `true` if the server believes the fingerprint to be sent by a virtual machine.

isTamperedAndroidBuild.description: Set to `true` if the Android OS build is suspected to be modified or tampered with (e.g., the device is not running the standard manufacturer-provided Android build). This may occur when custom ROMs or altered OS images are installed. This flag is only reported for Android devices.

sessionAgeMinutes.description: The age of the session in minutes, calculated from when the session was created to now.

createdAt.description: The time at which the network information was captured.

srcIp.description: The source IP address of the packet.

os.description: The operating system computed from the packet data.

osFlavor.description: Additional details about the version of OS computed.

BehavioralNavigationContextSummary.description: Contains a summary of the events that are part of a single navigation context contained by a single Window.

tabId.description:
The ID of the tab that the user is currently on. This is a web specific feature and will be
null for mobile devices.

combinedContext.description:
The combined navigation context for a given application. On web, this is the combination of the
context and hash. On native, this is just the context.

estimatedStartTimestamp.description:
An estimation of the real world clock time when the context started. This is a
best effort to combine the monotonic clock time with the real world clock time to 
create a continuous timeline of events.

timeInContext.description: The estimated total amount of time spent in the given navigation context in milliseconds.

timeInForeground.description:
The amount of time the given context was in the foreground. I.e., the application or tab was
not backgrounded.

ipAddresses.description: The list of IP addresses that were used by the user during the given navigation context.

submissionCount.description: The number of times a form was submitted during the given navigation context. This is a web specific feature.

backgroundCount.description: The number of times the application or tab was backgrounded during the given navigation context.

entity.description: The unique identifier for the entity (e.g., email or phone number).

profile.description: The profile details corresponding to the entity.

seenCount.description: The number of times the entity has been seen in the system.

firstSeen.description: The first time the entity was observed in the system.

lastSeen.description: The last time the entity was observed in the system.

deviceTypes.description: The most recent device types associated with the entity.

deviceModels.description: The most recent device models associated with the entity.

deviceisps.description: The most recent ISPs (Internet Service Providers) associated with the entity.

deviceLanguages.description: The most recent device languages associated with the entity.

deviceTimezones.description: The most recent timezones associated with the entity.

networkLocationStates.description: The most recent states inferred from the entity's network location.

networkLocationPostalCodes.description: The most recent postal codes inferred from the entity's network location.

DigitalIntelligenceResponse.title: Digital Intelligence
DigitalIntelligenceResponse.description: Provides access to the Digital Intelligence API through ID+

digitalIntelligence.description: Contains additional information about the request.

id.description: Unique UUID for the device.

sessionCreatedAt.description: The time at which the session was created

deviceCaptureAt.description:
The time at which device metadata was captured. If multiple captures were made against the 
given session, this is the most recent timestamp.

connectionIp.description: The IP address detected by the connection to the ingestion service.

forwardedForIps.description: The collection of IP addresses in the `X-Forwarded-For` header during the ingestion request.

webRtcPublicIp.description: The public facing IP address as detected by WebRTC when available.

webRtcInternalIp.description: The internal facing IP address as detected by WebRTC when available.

realIp.description: Real IP address detected in association with the lastSeen time. This address is computed to be the most specific address associated with the user. All attributes are relative to this address.

isTor.description: Set to `true` if the IP is a TOR exit node.

isProxy.description: Set to `true` if a Proxy is detected.

isVpn.description: Set to `true` if the device appears to be connected via a VPN.

isConsumerPrivacy.description: Set to `true` if the device is detected to be using a consumer privacy relay such as iCloud Private Relay or Google One VPN.

isRiskyNetwork.description: Set to `true` if the device appears to be associated with a known high-risk IP address or IP block. The value is computed by Socure based on proprietary methods.

isp.description: Name of the Internet Service Provider associated with the IP address.

ispType.description: Returns the type of ISP connection. Possible values can be 'home' or 'business'.

asnName.description: Name associated to the ASN identifier.

domainName.description: Domain name associated with the IP address.

org.description: Name of the organization associated with the IP address.

isMobileCarrier.description: Set to `true` if IP appears to be associated with a mobile carrier.

speed.description: Provides connection type and speed information.

region.description: State, Province, or Region 2 Char code.

city.description: City Name

timezoneName.description: The unique name of the timezone in the form "Area/Location".

gmtOffset.description: The UTC offset is the difference in hours and minutes between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local solar time, at a particular place. This difference is expressed with respect to UTC and is generally shown in the format ±[hh]:[mm], ±[hh][mm], or ±[hh].

sdkVersion.description: The version of the Socure SDK reporting the data.

platform.description: The SDK platform used to create the platform.

osVersion.description: The version of the operating system in use.

deviceModel.description: The model of the device being used.

deviceType.description: The format of the device being used.

viewportWidth.description: The logical width of the viewport on native devices and the logical innerWidth of the window on web.

viewportHeight.description: The logical height of the viewport on native devices and the logical innerHeight of the window on web.

screenHeight.description: The logical height of the screen.

screenWidth.description: The logical width of the screen.

devicePixelRatio.description: The number of physical pixels for each logical pixel on the screen.

network.description: General network information about the device. Note that this is different from the mobile network cellular information contained in `mobileNetwork`.

vpnStatus.description: true if the vpn is enabled, false otherwise. Note that is value is not available for web.

location.description: The GPS coordinates of the device as reported by the devices location services.

latitude.description: The latitude of the location in degrees.

longitude.description: The longitude of the location in degrees.

horizontalAccuracy.description: The radius of uncertainty of the reported location in meters.

altitude.description: The altitude above the WGS 84 ellipsoid in meters.

verticalAccuracy.description: The accuracy of the reported altitude in meters.

bearing.description: The bearing of the device in degrees.

bearingAccuracy.description: The accuracy of the reported bearing in degrees. Not reported on web.

speed.description: The speed of the device in meters per second.

speedAccuracy.description: The accuracy of the reported speed in meters per second. Not reported on web.

battery.description: Information regarding the battery for the device.

batteryState.description: The charging status for the battery. Definitions map directly to https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uidevice/batterystate

batteryLevel.description: The level of the battery charge with 0 being empty and 1 being full.

timeZone.description: The name of the time zone the device is set to.

timeZoneOffset.description: The number of minutes the device is offset from the UTC time zone.

language.description: The primary language configured for the device.

deviceArchitecture.description: Describes the architecture of the device.

applicationType.description: Corresponds to the type of application that uses the SDK.

isEmulator.description: Set to `true` if the device is detected to be an emulator.

deviceContext.description: Corresponds to the context passed into `processDevice(...)` in the SDK. Expected possible values from `deviceContext` include `homepage`, `signup`, `login`, `password`, `checkout`, `profile`, `transaction` or any custom value the customer may provide. Value of `default` is used on initialization and is `unknown` if a value isn't passed to `processDevice(...)`.

isRooted.description: Set to `true` if the device is detected to have been rooted.

mobileNetwork.description: Contains the cellular network info for a single or dual sim device.

matches.description:
This object contains one or more source list keys relevant to the input entity. For each retrieved source list key, the associated data is presented in an array of objects.
> **Note**: The details contained within the `matches` object will be dynamic based on the source information.

source-list-key.description: An array of objects that contain match details of the input entity to this specific source list.

entityId.description: A 30 character ID representative of an entity.

matchFields.description:
Array containing the name and DOB match type. Below are the possible values.
  * `nameExact`: Exact name match.
  * `nameFuzzy`: Fuzzy name match.
  * `nameEquivalent`: Name match based on the same name meaning.
  * `removedPersonalTitle`: Partial name match due to the removal of an honorary title within the input name such as (Dr, Mr, Queen, etc.).
  * `nameInitialized`: Name match based on initials.
  * `namePhonetic`: Name match based on phonetic similarity.
  * `akaExact`: Exact alias match.
  * `akaFuzzy`: Fuzzy alias match.
  * `akaEquivalent`: Alias match based on the same alias meaning.
  * `akaPhonetic`: Alias name match based on phonetic similarity.
  * `dobExact`: DOB matches year, month, and day.
  * `dobFuzzy`: DOB is within one year (+/-) from the entered DOB.
  * `dobNotOnRecord`: The source either does not contain a DOB for the matched entity, or the entered DOB does not match the data on the file.

sourceUrls.description: Link to the source/ article where the matched entity was listed/found.

comments.description:
The `comments` object contains dynamic data that varies based on the source. It may include personal details, sanctions information, identifiers, and aliases, but the keys and values can differ depending on the data source.

A general JSON schema for the `comments` object is as follows:

- Keys are dynamic and can vary by source.
- Values can be strings, arrays, or serialized objects.

**Example structure**:

```json
"comments": {
  "key1": ["value1", "value2"],
  "key2": "value3",
  "key3": [
    "{'nestedKey': 'value'}",
    "{'nestedKey2': 'value2'}"
  ]
}
```
**Note**:
  - Key behaviors: 
    - Missing keys are handled by being omitted or set to `null`.
    - Unexpected keys are either ignored or passed through.
  - We recommend dynamically handling the `comments` object by:
    - Iterating over key-value pairs.
    - Conditionally parsing serialized or nested values.

**Payload example: OFAC source**
```json title="Example 1: OFAC source"
"comments": {
  "listName": ["SDN List"],
  "program": ["GLOMAG"],
  "name": ["Olesya Anatolevna Mendeleeva"],
  "countries": ["RU"],
  "aka": ["Alias1", "Alias2"]
}
```  
**Payload example: Another source**
  ```json title="Example 2: Another source"
  "comments": {
    "sanctionsType": ["Entity"],
    "identifier": ["12345"],
    "programCode": ["ABC"],
    "additionalInfo": [
      "{'infoType': 'Notes', 'content': 'Additional details here'}"
    ]
  }                        
  ```
**Mapping table**:
  | Key               | Source (Example)      | Description                                 |
  |-------------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------------------|
  | `listName`        | OFAC                  | Represents the sanction list name (e.g., SDN List). |
  | `sanctionsType`   | Another Source        | Describes the type of sanction (e.g., Entity). |
  | `identifier`      | Another Source        | A unique identifier for the entity.        |
  | `aka`             | OFAC                  | Alias names for the entity or individual.   |
  | `programCode`     | Another Source        | Code for the sanction program (e.g., ABC).   |
  | `countries`       | OFAC                  | Countries associated with the sanctions.    |

comments.description:
The `comments` object contains dynamic data that varies based on the source. It may include personal details, sanctions information, identifiers, and aliases, but the keys and values can differ depending on the data source.

A general JSON schema for the `comments` object is as follows:

- Keys are dynamic and can vary by source.
- Values can be strings, arrays, or serialized objects.

**Example structure**:

```json
"comments": {
  "key1": ["value1", "value2"],
  "key2": "value3",
  "key3": [
    "{'nestedKey': 'value'}",
    "{'nestedKey2': 'value2'}"
  ]
}
```
**Note**:
  - Key behaviors: 
    - Missing keys are handled by being omitted or set to `null`.
    - Unexpected keys are either ignored or passed through.
  - We recommend dynamically handling the `comments` object by:
    - Iterating over key-value pairs.
    - Conditionally parsing serialized or nested values.

**Payload example: OFAC source**
```json title="Example 1: OFAC source"
"comments": {
  "listName": ["SDN List"],
  "program": ["GLOMAG"],
  "name": ["Olesya Anatolevna Mendeleeva"],
  "countries": ["RU"],
  "aka": ["Alias1", "Alias2"]
}
```  
**Payload example: Another source**
  ```json title="Example 2: Another source"
  "comments": {
    "sanctionsType": ["Entity"],
    "identifier": ["12345"],
    "programCode": ["ABC"],
    "additionalInfo": [
      "{'infoType': 'Notes', 'content': 'Additional details here'}"
    ]
  }                        
  ```
**Mapping table**:
  | Key               | Source (Example)      | Description                                 |
  |-------------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------------------|
  | `listName`        | OFAC                  | Represents the sanction list name (e.g., SDN List). |
  | `sanctionsType`   | Another Source        | Describes the type of sanction (e.g., Entity). |
  | `identifier`      | Another Source        | A unique identifier for the entity.        |
  | `aka`             | OFAC                  | Alias names for the entity or individual.   |
  | `programCode`     | Another Source        | Code for the sanction program (e.g., ABC).   |
  | `countries`       | OFAC                  | Countries associated with the sanctions.    |

globalWatchlist.description: Contains reason codes and information about matches on monitored lists. See [Call the Global Watchlist Module with the ID+ API](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/call-global-watchlist-module) for an example response.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

matches.description:
This object contains one or more source list keys relevant to the input entity. For each retrieved source list key, the associated data is presented in an array of objects.
> **Note**: The details contained within the `matches` object will be dynamic based on the source information.

source-list-key.description: An array of objects that contain match details of the input entity to this specific source list.

entityId.description: A 30 character ID representative of an entity.

matchFields.description:
Array containing the name and DOB match type. Below are the possible values.
  * `nameExact`: Exact name match.
  * `nameFuzzy`: Fuzzy name match.
  * `nameEquivalent`: Name match based on the same name meaning.
  * `removedPersonalTitle`: Partial name match due to the removal of an honorary title within the input name such as (Dr, Mr, Queen, etc.).
  * `nameInitialized`: Name match based on initials.
  * `namePhonetic`: Name match based on phonetic similarity.
  * `akaExact`: Exact alias match.
  * `akaFuzzy`: Fuzzy alias match.
  * `akaEquivalent`: Alias match based on the same alias meaning.
  * `akaPhonetic`: Alias name match based on phonetic similarity.
  * `dobExact`: DOB matches year, month, and day.
  * `dobFuzzy`: DOB is within one year (+/-) from the entered DOB.
  * `dobNotOnRecord`: The source either does not contain a DOB for the matched entity, or the entered DOB does not match the data on the file.

sourceUrls.description: Link to the source/ article where the matched entity was listed/found.

comments.description:
The `comments` object contains dynamic data that varies based on the source. It may include personal details, sanctions information, identifiers, and aliases, but the keys and values can differ depending on the data source.
A general JSON schema for the `comments` object is as follows:
- Keys are dynamic and can vary by source. - Values can be strings, arrays, or serialized objects.
**Example structure**:
```json "comments": {
  "key1": ["value1", "value2"],
  "key2": "value3",
  "key3": [
    "{'nestedKey': 'value'}",
    "{'nestedKey2': 'value2'}"
  ]
} ``` **Note**:
  - Key behaviors: 
    - Missing keys are handled by being omitted or set to `null`.
    - Unexpected keys are either ignored or passed through.
  - We recommend dynamically handling the `comments` object by:
    - Iterating over key-value pairs.
    - Conditionally parsing serialized or nested values.

**Payload example: OFAC source** ```json title="Example 1: OFAC source" "comments": {
  "listName": ["SDN List"],
  "program": ["GLOMAG"],
  "name": ["Olesya Anatolevna Mendeleeva"],
  "countries": ["RU"],
  "aka": ["Alias1", "Alias2"]
} ```   **Payload example: Another source**
  ```json title="Example 2: Another source"
  "comments": {
    "sanctionsType": ["Entity"],
    "identifier": ["12345"],
    "programCode": ["ABC"],
    "additionalInfo": [
      "{'infoType': 'Notes', 'content': 'Additional details here'}"
    ]
  }                        
  ```
**Mapping table**:
  | Key               | Source (Example)      | Description                                 |
  |-------------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------------------|
  | `listName`        | OFAC                  | Represents the sanction list name (e.g., SDN List). |
  | `sanctionsType`   | Another Source        | Describes the type of sanction (e.g., Entity). |
  | `identifier`      | Another Source        | A unique identifier for the entity.        |
  | `aka`             | OFAC                  | Alias names for the entity or individual.   |
  | `programCode`     | Another Source        | Code for the sanction program (e.g., ABC).   |
  | `countries`       | OFAC                  | Countries associated with the sanctions.    |

distinguishingMarksAndCharacteristics.description: Refers to the entity's physical characteristics or distinguishing features such as scars, birthmarks, tattoos, moles, or other visible marks on the body.

scarsMarksAndTattoos.description: Refers to the entity's physical characteristics or distinguishing features such as scars, birthmarks, tattoos, moles, or other visible marks on the body as noted in the data source.

parentCompany.description: The corporation that owns or controls the company the entity is associated with as specified in the data source.

medicaidNumber.description: A unique identification code assigned to individuals enrolled in the Medicaid health program according to the government agency overseeing the program. Medicaid provides health coverage to low-income individuals including children, pregnant women, the disabled, elderly, and parents of dependent children.

type.description: The category or kind represented by the data element.

position.description: The role, job or placement held by an entity according to the data source.

rank.description: Refers to the position or level of significance assigned to the entity.

description.description: An account or explanation of the entity, entity or associated item as provided in the data source.

division.description: An administrative district or unit of an organization as specified in the data source.

joinedHouseOfLords.description: The date or time when an individual became a member of the House of Lords, which is the upper chamber of the Parliament in the United Kingdom.

parliamentaryCommittee.description: Indicates that the entity has been subject to scrutiny, investigation, or inquiry by a parliamentary committee.

regulator.description: An official entity that supervises or controls a business activity or organization as noted in the data source.

telephone.description: A device for transmitting speech or data to a distant point according to the data source.

extract.description: Information that has been obtained or taken from another source.

crd.description: The Central Registration Depository. A computer database maintained by FINRA that contains information on registered representatives and their employers according to the data source.

basisDate.description: The date used as a starting point for a calculation, comparison or determination as provided in the data source.

number.description: An itemized account, register or series associated with the entity or entity as noted in the data source.

market.description: An economic system or structure where goods and services are exchanged according to the data source.

removalDate.description: The date when the entity or entity was eliminated or taken away from a position, membership or list as specified in the data source.

eyes.description: The color of the entity's irises as specified in the data source.

hair.description: The entity's natural hair color and texture, according to the data source.

caseNo.description: The official reference number assigned to a legal matter regarding the entity according to the data source.

nationalId.description: A unique identification code issued to the individual by a national government agency according to the data source.

imoNumber.description: An official registration number issued to a company, vessel or facility by the International Maritime Organization according to the data source.

additionalDetails.description: Supplementary information related to the individual or entity that provides further context or clarification according to the data source.

neutralCitationNumber.description: An alphanumeric reference number assigned to a legal case for the purpose of citation according to the data source.

category.description: A class or division into which the individual or associated item is placed according to the data source.

enfocementType.description: The specific measures or actions taken to compel compliance with laws, regulations, rules, policies, or obligations according to the data source.

citizenship.description: The country where an individual holds legal nationality or the status of being a citizen according to the data source.

companyNumber.description: An official registration or incorporation number assigned to a business entity according to the data source.

facilityName.description: The title or proper designation of a place, building or structure used for a specific purpose according to the data source.

positionOfEmployment.description: The role, job or responsibilities the individual holds within an organization according to the data source.

fax.description: A method for the transmission of written communications or images over a telecommunications channel which uses telephone lines or another dedicated channel according to the data source.

matchScore.description: A value between 1 and 100 that represents how closely the individual name matches the name or alias on the source list. 1 indicates that the name is not likely a match, while 100 indicates that the name exactly matches the name of the returned entity.

entityCorrelationScore.description: A value between 1 and 100 representing the likelihood of a potential hit being a true match with the provided PII. A score of 1 indicates that the entity is unlikely to be a match, while a score of 100 indicates a high likelihood that the entity matches the returned hit. See [Entity Correlation Score](/docs/id-plus/modules/global-watchlist/entity-correlation-score) for more information.

GraphIntelligenceResponse.title: Graph Intelligence
GraphIntelligenceResponse.description: Contains the Graph Intelligence module features for the primary key.

graphIntelligence.description: Contains the overall decision outcome for the transaction, along with individual module outcomes and the reason codes or scores that influenced each decision.

dateFirstSeen.description: The date on which Socure first saw the given primary key in a transaction.

daysSinceFirstSeen.description:
The number of days between the transaction date and the `dateFirstSeen`.

*User tip: `dateFirstSeen` and `daysSinceFirstSeen` are similar in meaning, but `daysSinceFirstSeen` as a numeric value is easier to immediately set thresholds against.*

dateLastSeen.description: The date on which Socure last saw the given primary key in a transaction.

daysSinceLastSeen.description: The number of days between the transaction date (or submission date when provided) and the `dateLastSeen`.

countTimesSeen.description: The number of transactions in which Socure has seen the given primary key.

countDatesSeen.description:
The number of distinct dates on which Socure has seen the given primary key in a transaction.

*User tip: Look at both `countTimesSeen` and `countDatesSeen`. Generally these values should be equal or close to each other, but if `countTimesSeen` is much larger than `countDatesSeen` it can indicate suspicious velocities.*
